purpose.text: It was meant to stand between the helpless and the moment that breaks them.
It was built to end a siege quickly—one decisive act, one spared winter.
It was designed to notice what everyone else politely ignores.
It was made to find roads where none should exist, and to close them just as easily.
It was intended for the subtle work—doors that open, voices that soften, footsteps that vanish.
It was shaped to ease pain, though its mercy was never promised to be free.
It was created to bargain with the unquiet dead from a position of strength.
